text.0: forth speed the pair to bring the meditating god benevolent with boons sent in return for boons.
text.1: may indra graciously accept both gifts from us when he hath knowledge of the flowing soma juice.
text.2: thou wanderest far o indra through the spheres of light and realms of earth the region thou whom many praise.
text.3: let those who often bring their solemn rites conquer the noisy babblers who present no gifts.
text.4: more beautiful than beauty must this seem to me when the son duly careth for his parents line.
text.5: the wife attracts the husband with a shout of joy the mans auspicious marriage is performed aright.
text.6: this beauteous place of meeting have i looked upon where like milchcows the kine order the marriage train.
text.7: where the herds mother counts as first and best of all and round her are the seventoned people of the choir.
text.8: the pious one hath reached your place before the rest one only moves victorious with the rudras band.
text.9: to these your helpers pour our meath immortal gods with whom your song of praise hath power to win their gifts.
text.10: he who maintains the laws of god informed me that thou wast lying hidden in the waters.
text.11: indra who knoweth well beheld and showed thee by him instructed am i come o agni.
text.12: the stranger asks the way of him who knows it taught by the skilful guide he travels onward.
text.13: this is in truth the blessing of instruction he finds the path that leads directly forward.
text.14: even now he breathed these days hath he remembered concealed he sucked the bosom of his mother.
text.15: yet in his youth old age hath come upon him he hath grown gracious good and free from anger.
text.16: o kalasa all these blessings will we bring them o kurusravana who give rich presents.
text.17: may he o wealthy princes and this soma which i am bearing in my heart reward you.
